Class ProgressIndicator 

java.lang.Object
   |
   +----java.awt.Component
           |
           +----java.awt.Container
                   |
                   +----java.awt.Panel
                           |
                           +----ProgressIndicator
public class ProgressIndicator
extends Panel
An implementation of a simple progress indicator that is useful to show the progress of lengthy tasks such as loading files and searching databases.

Version:
0.1 22-Sept-1997
Author:
Kelvin R. Lawrence

APPEARANCE_RAISED
APPEARANCE_SUNKEN
VALUES_ABSOLUTE
VALUES_PERCENTAGE

ProgressIndicator()
Create a progress indicator with no initial value.
ProgressIndicator(int)
Create a progress indicator specifying its initial value.
ProgressIndicator(int, int)
Create a progress indicator specifying the initial value and mode.

getMode()
Get the value of the current mode.

getStatusBarTextColor()
getValue()
paint(Graphics)
setAppearance(int)
setMode(int)
Set the current mode to be either absolute or percentage mode.
setStatusBarColor(Color)

VALUES_PERCENTAGE 
 public static final int VALUES_PERCENTAGE

 public static final int VALUES_ABSOLUTE

 public static final int APPEARANCE_SUNKEN
APPEARANCE_RAISED 
 public static final int APPEARANCE_RAISED

ProgressIndicator 
 public ProgressIndicator()
Create a progress indicator with no initial value. This will in effect cause the value to be intialized to zero. The mode will be defaulted to percentage mode.

ProgressIndicator 
 public ProgressIndicator(int value)
Create a progress indicator specifying its initial value. The mode will be defaulted to percentage mode.

Parameters:
value - The initial value setting of the status bar.
See Also:
setValue
ProgressIndicator 
 public ProgressIndicator(int value,
                          int mode)
Create a progress indicator specifying the initial value and mode.

Parameters:
value - The initial value setting of the status bar.
mode - The initial mode.
See Also:
setMode, setValue

setMode 
 public void setMode(int newMode)
Set the current mode to be either absolute or percentage mode.

Parameters:
newMode - The mode being set.
See Also:
getMode
getMode 
 public int getMode()
Get the value of the current mode.

See Also:
setMode
setValue 
 public void setValue(int newValue)
Set the current value to be displayed in the status bar. This will either be a percentage or an absolute value depending upong the current mode.

Parameters:
newValue - The value being set.
See Also:
setMode, getValue
getValue 
 public int getValue()
